item.title: Dead of Darkness is a 2D survival horror releasing on January 23rd
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2024/12/14/dead-of-darkness-is-a-2d-survival-horror-releasing-on-january-23rd/

Dead of Darkness is a new 2D survival horror that is looking to kick off 2025 with some fear. Developer Retrofiction Games has announced that its take on the horror genre will be released on January 23rd, and it is coming to PC via Steam. You will see from the trailer that Dead of Darkness features lots of different horror elements including body horror, jump scares, and a creepy child.

Dead of Darkness is set on the fictional English island known as Velvet Island, and the year is 1985. The main character is private investigator Miles Windham, who has travelled to the island to find out why his sister died there. On its facade, the institution on Velvel Island is a hospital, but strip away that layer and it is a place of horror not healing. Much of the game will be based around puzzle solving, though there will be combat too in a bid to escape from various enemies and creatures. Some enemies will continue to pursue you so you will have to get away from them, and watch out. There are 15 characters that are on Velvet Island that have their own stories to tell too. Resource management will be a key focus in Dead of Darkness as there are not many items that will be available to help, so every encounter has to be planned for. Miles’ mental state will also have a toll taken on it, the more powerful the hallucinations he will experience. As a investigator, Miles will need to piece together clues found around Velvet Island to discover its secrets, and work out what happened to his sister.

Dead of Darkness is available to wishlist and you can grab a demo through the Dead of Darkness Steam page.

Source: Press Release

item.title: Something for the Weekend – 14/12/24
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2024/12/14/something-for-the-weekend-14-12-24/

The Game Awards was pretty good this year, wasn’t it? I think they got a pretty good balance of awards, time for speeches, muppet-filled interludes and (of course) plenty of big announcements to get your gaming juices flowing.

With that in mind, let’s dive in and see all the biggest announcements from the TGAs, Day of the Devs, and plenty more besides.

In the News This Week

  • Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet is Naughty Dog’s next big game
  • The Witcher 4 revealed with Ciri as the protagonist
  • See the teaser trailer for Fumito Ueda’s next game – Shadow of the Gundam?
  • Hideki Kamiya is working on a sequel to Okami
  • Onimusha: Way of the Sword revealed for 2026!
  • It’s finally happening! We’re getting a new Virtua Fighter!
  • Elden Ring: Nightreign revealed, leans in on multiplayer
  • Split Fiction is the new co-op game from Josef Fares – and he only used a few rude words to announce it
  • RGG reveal Project Century – Like a Dragon goes back to 1915
  • The Outer Worlds 2 is coming to PS5 as well as PC and Xbox in 2025
  • Turok: Origins is rebooting the dinosaur-hunting legend with Saber Interactive
  • Everything announced during Day of the Devs TGA 2024 edition
  • People Can Fly suspend project and layoff 120 employees

Games in Review & Featured Articles

We had a small batch of games in review this week, with some real highs and lows amongst them.

  • Among Ashes – PS5, PC – 8/10
  • Shadow Tactics: Aiko’s Choice – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver 1&2 Remastered – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, NSW, PC – 5/10
  • Mighty Morphin’ Power Rangers: Rita’s Rewind – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, PC – 4/10

We also had a high-end gaming headset

  • Corsair Virtuoso Max – 8/10

Aside from this, it was the 20th anniversary of the PSP launch (right around the 30th anniversary of PlayStation in general), and Dom looked back on what was once a bleeding edge gaming handheld.

Elsewhere, Jim delved into Warhammer 40,000: Darktide for its PS5 launch, and Aran checked out the early access launch of Overthrown. I shared a little more about Wargaming’s new game Steel Hunters, and interviewed the solo dev behind the cosy rocket factory game Little Rocket Lab.

Rounding things out as always, What We Played featured Indiana Jones, Space Marine 2 and watching The Game Awards.

Trailer Park

Watch the Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet announcement

Check out the new trailer for Borderlands 4

Mafia: The Old Country has a very cinematic trailer

Dispatch is a superhero workplace comedy from the writers of Tales of the Borderlands

Ultimate Sheep Raccoon is a bike racing sequel to Ultimate Chicken Horse

That’s the round up for this week. Hope you have a great weekend ahead!
